page.title: 09WEST MERSEA SEA WALL.
page.content: The sea wall is situated on West Mersea in between Ray Island and the caravan park. The reason for having a sea wall is because without one the Island would slowly get washed away, as every time the tide comes in it takes part of the mud away. The sea wall starts at the Strood, and goes down to the Dabchicks Sailing Club. On foot, it is about a fifteen minute walk. The sea wall used to look like just a grassy mound, but now, concrete slabs are being layed to make the wall stronger for years to come. The work on this stretch of the sea wall has taken a few years to complete.
